entry.title: future-of-the-plugin
entry.content:
**--- slug: Future of the Plugin title: Future of the Plugin authors: [DevGrain] tags: [SDS, Simple Dialogue System]​

We are working on something much bigger than the current version of SDS.​

We spent 2 years developing the SDS and we always wanted to make SDS something more than a dialogue plugin because we saw the inherit potential of the system and its possible application on game-making scene.

But this is something that can not be done in current code base. It's because we focused on the development of new features instead of refactoring the code due to the limited time on the development.

So we decided to work on SDS2.

How will the SDS2 be look like?​

We are aiming to make SDS2 as a StoryGraph system.

You will be able to make any dialogue, or cutscene productions with the SDS2, beyond just a mere text-based dialogue.

SDS2 will completely support multiplayer games and replicated dialogues.

SDS2 will be reinforced with a ton of better editing features. Every stuff and Every property can be accessible and duplicate-able in the graph side so you don't need to mess around the detail panel.

SDS2 will have its own text animation system that is powered by our new slate animation module, Volt. Volt library will also be included in the SDS2 to provide much more convincing editor visual and runtime animations.

We can not the all the stuff by right now, but there will be a lot of changes on the system, and it will be something that you've never seen before from elsewhere.

Should I buy SDS2 again?​

No, Since the SDS1 will be updated to the SDS2, the users of the SDS1 don't need to buy SDS again.

When will it be released?​

There is nothing I can be sure about it, but it will take at least 3~5 months to finish.

Future of SDS1​

By the 1.16.4 update, we already implemented everything we had in mind for the SDS.

We will keep active in providing patch versions for the LTS version (1.16.x) for SDS1.

We will actively share the news of SDS2 here. If you have any questions related to the product, please contact me via devgrain13@gmail.com
